Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock slammed the highest score so far in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 to star in South Africa's win over Bangladesh
Heinrich Klaasen hit 90 from 49 balls, which included eight sixes
David Miller finished with 34 from just 15 deliveries
Pre-Game Insights: The South Africa openers started positively, although they were assisted by a dropped chance in the second over
Shakib Al Hasan, who replaced Towhid Hridoy in the playing XI, added that he didn't mind bowling first, embracing the opportunity to attempt to restrict the opponents to a reasonable total
Post-Match Reflections: Mahmudullah ensured some pride was restored for Bangladesh with an excellent knock from number six, helping his side avoid a record defeat with a defiant half-century that picked up pace as he began to run out of partners
Aided by the tail, Mahmudullah brought up his own individual milestone with a high-class hundred against South Africa's tiring attack, with his century coming from 104 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tanzid Hasan dropped a nick from Reeza Hendricks, whose cut shot had gone straight to the fielder
Shoriful Islam bowled an incisive delivery that beat the defences of Reeza Hendricks and rattled his stumps
Mehidy Hasan Miraz trapped Rassie van de Dussen leg before
South Africa's stand-in skipper Aiden Markram went for an inside-out drive against his opposite number but was grasped by Litton Das at long-on
